item.title: 纽约联储称量化紧缩政策可能在 2025 年停止
item.description: 根据纽约联邦储备银行的预测，美国中央银行可能会在 2025 年停止资产负债表的放松。【原文：The US central bank could halt the unwind of its balance sheet in 2025, according to Federal Reserve Bank of New York projections.】

item.title: 体育广播公司钻石公司将举行重组计划投票
item.description: 钻石体育集团（Diamond Sports Group）将就亚马逊公司（Amazon.com Inc.）支持的破产退出计划举行债权人投票，同时该广播公司将努力与美国两大体育联盟谈判新的电视转播协议。【原文：Diamond Sports Group will hold a creditor vote on a bankruptcy-exit plan backed by Amazon.com Inc. while the broadcaster tries to negotiate new television deals with two major US sports leagues.】

item.title: 曾在雷曼工作的债券市场专家杰克-马尔维逝世，享年 72 岁
item.description: 约翰-"杰克"-马尔维（John "Jack" Malvey）逝世，他在债券市场受人尊敬，从业数十年，曾长期担任雷曼兄弟控股公司（Lehman Brothers Holdings Inc.享年 72 岁。【原文：John “Jack” Malvey, a respected figure in the bond market whose decades in the industry included a long run as Lehman Brothers Holdings Inc.’s chief strategist in fixed income, has died. He was 72.】

item.title: 渴望收益的投资者抢购 20 年期美国国债
item.description: 20 年期美国国债拍卖吸引了强劲的需求，这表明接近年内最高水平的收益率为投资者提供了足够的补偿，以应对经济增长和通胀趋势将阻止美联储降息的风险。【原文：An auction of 20-year US Treasury bonds drew strong demand, suggesting that yields near the highest levels of the year offer investors enough compensation for the risk that growth and inflation trends will forestall Federal Reserve interest-rate cuts.】

item.title: 尼日利亚限制银行发放贷款以减少市场流动性
item.description: 尼日利亚中央银行限制银行发放贷款的能力，以减少市场流动性，帮助降低 3 月份升至 28 年新高的通货膨胀率。【原文：Nigeria’s central bank curbed the ability of banks to grant loans as it seeks to reduce market liquidity and help reduce an inflation rate that rose to a 28-year high in March.】

item.title: 森特诺称欧洲央行不会以美国经济为导向来设定利率
item.description: 马里奥-森特诺【原文：Mario Centeno】

item.title: 雷亚尔汇率跌至世界最差水平，吸引了一批特殊的熊市投资者
item.description: 外国基金正在加大对巴西雷亚尔的押注，使巴西雷亚尔成为全球表现最差的主要货币，原因是当地负面新闻不断，全球利率前景也被大幅重估。【原文：Foreign funds are stepping up bets against the Brazilian real, turning the currency into the worst major performer in the world amid a mix of negative local news and a massive repricing of the outlook for global interest rates.】

item.title: 蓬勃发展的首次公开募股背后的新泽西州小经纪商携 380% 的大手笔卷土重来
item.description: 两年前，一家名不见经传的新泽西经纪公司曾引领了全球最疯狂的股票发行，这次它又回来了，这家新加坡远程医疗初创公司上周上市，成为今年美国最热门的首次公开发行股票公司。【原文：A little-known New Jersey brokerage that led the world’s wildest stock offerings just two years ago is back, this time with a Singaporean telehealth startup that went public last week and is now the year’s hottest US initial public offering.】

item.title: 简街交易额达 106 亿美元
item.description: 简街集团有限责任公司（Jane Street Group LLC）去年的净交易收入达到 106 亿美元，这家自营交易公司继续巩固其作为市场主导者的地位。【原文：Jane Street Group LLC generated $10.6 billion in net trading revenue last year, as the proprietary-trading firm continues to cement its presence as a dominant market-maker.】

item.title: 特鲁多前财长批评资本利得税上调
item.description: 总理贾斯汀-特鲁多的前任财政部长表示，由于担心提高资本利得税将阻碍加拿大的经济增长，他在任时拒绝了提高资本利得税的想法，并称此举 "令许多投资者感到非常不安"。【原文：Prime Minister Justin Trudeau’s former finance minister said he rejected the idea of hiking the capital gains tax while in office due to concerns it would stunt Canada’s economic growth, and called the move “very troubling for many investors.”】

item.title: 联合国要求为加沙援助提供 25 亿美元，比早些时候多十倍
item.description: 联合国正在为加沙寻求 25 亿美元的人道主义援助，并将持续到今年余下的时间，这一数额与六个月前相比呈指数增长，凸显了以色列-哈马斯战争期间加沙人民的处境日益恶化。【原文：The United Nations is seeking $2.5 billion for humanitarian aid in Gaza through the rest of the year, an exponential increase from six months ago that underscores the deteriorating situation for those caught in the middle of the Israel-Hamas war.】

item.title: 伦敦市政府批准伦敦博物馆旧址办公项目
item.description: 尽管遭到了居民的反对，但伦敦市政府还是在周三批准了一项计划，在二级保护建筑巴比肯中心（Barbican Centre）附近新建一座办公大楼。【原文：The City of London approved a plan to build a new office block connected to the Grade 2 listed Barbican Centre on Wednesday, despite opposition from residents.】

item.title: 中国抨击美国调查其造船业的举动
item.description: 拜登政府计划对中国的海运、物流和造船业进行正式审查，中国政府对此进行了抨击，称这是 "基于国内政治需要 "的错误调查。【原文：China’s government blasted a Biden administration plan to launch a formal review of its maritime, logistics and shipbuilding sector, calling the investigation a mistake “based on the need of domestic politics.”】

item.title: 微软价值 130 亿美元的 OpenAI 交易将避免欧盟正式调查
item.description: 微软公司（Microsoft Corp. ）对 OpenAI 公司 130 亿美元的投资将避免受到欧盟兼并监管机构的正式调查，从而平息了人们对双方关系可能被迫破裂的担忧。【原文：Microsoft Corp.’s $13 billion investment into OpenAI Inc. is set to avoid a formal investigation by European Union merger watchdogs, calming fears that the relationship could be forced apart.】

item.title: 林德纳称德国应避免效仿美国 IRA，因为这不会降低通胀率
item.description: 德国财政部长克里斯蒂安-林德纳（Christian Lindner）警告他的联盟伙伴不要效仿美国的《降低通货膨胀法案》，称该法案名不副实，未能限制世界最大经济体的消费价格。【原文：German Finance Minister Christian Lindner warned his coalition partners against emulating the US Inflation Reduction Act, saying that contrary to its name it has failed to constrain consumer prices in the world’s biggest economy.】

item.title: 风险偏好回升，基本金属与股市同步反弹
item.description: 由于全球金融市场的风险偏好有所改善，且有关金属供应紧张的警告持续存在，铜价周三反弹。【原文：Copper rallied Wednesday as risk appetite improved in global financial markets and warnings about the metal’s tight supply dynamics persisted.】

item.title: 华尔街银行领袖欢呼 IPO 市场萌芽复苏
item.description: 在 Reddit Inc. 和 Galderma Group AG 等公司上市增加了承销收入之后，华尔街最大银行的领导人对首次公开募股市场的重新开放持乐观态度。【原文：The leaders of Wall Street’s largest banks are optimistic about the reopening of the market for initial public offerings, after listings by firms such as Reddit Inc. and Galderma Group AG boosted underwriting revenues.】

item.title: 巴西国家石油公司主席重返因竞争而分裂的董事会
item.description: 巴西一名法官恢复了巴西石油公司（Petroleo Brasileiro SA）董事长的职务，因为政府任命的董事会成员与代表拉丁美洲最大石油生产商的小股东之间的矛盾正在激化。【原文：A Brazilian judge has reinstated Petroleo Brasileiro SA’s chairman as acrimony intensifies between government-appointed board members and those representing minority shareholders of Latin America’s largest oil producer.】

item.title: 加拿大不顾美国投诉将于 2024 年开始对科技巨头征税
item.description: 加拿大将于今年开始对全球最大的科技公司征收拟议税，尽管美国立法者威胁要对这一主要打击美国公司的征税进行贸易报复。【原文：Canada will start applying a proposed tax on the world’s biggest technology companies this year, despite threats from American lawmakers to carry out trade reprisals against a levy that will primarily hit US firms.】

item.title: KKR 计划对医疗运输提供商 GMR 进行债务重组
item.description: 据一位熟悉相关安排的人士透露，KKR & Co.正准备为医疗运输提供商 Global Medical Response Inc. 超过 40 亿美元的债务进行再融资，部分方法是说服债权人接受期限更长的债务和优先股。【原文：KKR & Co. is preparing to refinance more than $4 billion of debt at medical transport provider Global Medical Response Inc. in part by persuading creditors to accept longer-dated debt along with preferred stock, according to a person familiar with the arrangements.】

item.title: 芝加哥推进借款 12.5 亿美元用于发展的计划
item.description: 芝加哥市议会财政委员会周三批准了一项提案，在五年内平均出售高达 12.5 亿美元的住房和经济发展债券，以刺激经济增长和提供更多经济适用房。【原文：The Chicago City Council finance committee on Wednesday approved a proposal to sell up to $1.25 billion in housing and economic development bonds, split evenly over five years, to spur economic growth and more affordable homes.】

item.title: 联合利华在英国和爱尔兰召回 Magnum 杏仁冰淇淋棒
item.description: 联合利华公司（Unilever Plc）发布公告称，由于产品中可能含有塑料和金属，为谨慎起见，将在英国和爱尔兰召回少量玛格南杏仁雪糕棒。【原文：Unilever Plc is recalling a limited number of its Magnum almond ice-cream sticks in the UK and Ireland as a precaution due to the possible presence of plastic and metal, according to a company notice.】

item.title: 耶伦会见日本和韩国同行，希望促进经济关系
item.description: 周三，美国财政部长珍妮特-耶伦（Janet Yellen）会见了日本和韩国的财政部长，美国与其在亚洲的两大盟友之间的三方合作扩展到了金融领域。【原文：Three-way collaboration between the US and its top two allies in Asia extended Wednesday to the field of finance as Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen met her Japanese and South Korean counterparts.】

item.title: 国际货币基金组织新政临近，厄瓜多尔债券引领新兴市场涨势
item.description: 由于有迹象表明厄瓜多尔即将与国际货币基金组织达成新的融资协议，厄瓜多尔的美元债券跳涨，在发展中国家中涨幅居前。【原文：Ecuador’s dollar bonds jumped, leading gains among developing nations on signs a new financing deal with the International Monetary Fund is imminent.】

item.title: 萨尔瓦多在全球债务出售后回购 4.87 亿美元债券
item.description: 萨尔瓦多近四年来首次进入全球资本市场，回购了 4.87 亿美元的硬通货债券。【原文：El Salvador bought back $487 million of its hard-currency bonds after tapping the global capital market for the first time in almost four years.】

item.title: 前巴利亚斯尼伦敦办事处主管欧文关闭其对冲基金
item.description: 大约四年前，斯蒂芬-欧文（Stephen Irvine）离开巴利亚斯尼资产管理公司（Balyasny Asset Management），创办了自己的对冲基金，并将资金返还给投资者。【原文：Stephen Irvine, who left Balyasny Asset Management to start his own hedge fund about four years ago, is returning capital to investors.】

item.title: 养老金和捐赠基金模仿对冲基金的 "Pod Shop "策略
item.description: 养老金和捐赠基金正在借鉴巨型多管理人对冲基金的做法，自己也在尝试。【原文：Pensions and endowments are borrowing from the playbook of giant multimanager hedge funds — and giving it a go themselves.】

item.title: EQT考虑阿泽里斯选择权，收购者兴趣盎然
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，私募股权公司 EQT AB 在收到潜在买家的兴趣后，正在考虑比利时化学品分销公司 Azelis Group NV 的收购方案。【原文：Private equity firm EQT AB is considering options for Belgian chemical distribution company Azelis Group NV after receiving interest from potential buyers, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 虫害困扰阿根廷农作物，米莱恢复计划遭遇挫折
item.description: 在近乎完美的天气条件结束了多年的干旱之后，阿根廷玉米种植者对本季的收成寄予厚望。创纪录的收成也预示着哈维尔-米莱伊总统扭转国家陷入困境的经济的计划将获得成功。【原文：Argentina corn farmers had high hopes for this season’s harvest after near-perfect weather conditions ended years of drought. A record crop would also bode well for President Javier Milei’s plan to turn around the nation’s embattled economy.】

item.title: 津巴布韦希望今年启动由工作人员监督的国际货币基金组织（IMF）项目
item.description: 津巴布韦自 1999 年以来就因拖欠债务而被逐出资本市场，它希望在今年晚些时候加深与国际货币基金组织的联系，因为它正努力清偿数十亿美元的欠款。【原文：Zimbabwe, banished from capital markets since 1999 for defaulting on its debt, hopes to deepen ties with the International Monetary Fund later this year as it seeks to clear billions of dollars in arrears.】
